subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: The South of France is renowned for its beautiful coastline along the Mediterranean Sea. Here are some activities to enjoy by the sea: Beach Hopping: Nice - Visit the sandy shores and enjoy the vibrant Promenade des Anglais; Antibes - Relax on the pebbled beaches and explore the charming old town; Saint-Tropez - Experience the exclusive beach clubs and glamorous atmosphere; Marseille to Cassis - Explore the stunning limestone cliffs and hidden coves of Calanques National Park; Îles d'Hyères - Discover pristine beaches and excellent snorkeling opportunities on islands like Porquerolles and Port-Cros; Cannes - Enjoy the sandy beaches and luxury beach clubs along the Boulevard de la Croisette; Menton - Visit the serene beaches and beautiful gardens in this charming town near the Italian border.

In addition to dining at top restaurants, there are several culinary experiences you should consider: Cooking Classes - Many towns and cities in the South of France offer cooking classes where you can learn to prepare traditional dishes like bouillabaisse, ratatouille, and tarte tropézienne. These classes are a great way to immerse yourself in the local culture and gain hands-on experience with regional recipes. Some classes even include a visit to a local market to shop for fresh ingredients. Wine Tours - The South of France is renowned for its wine regions, including Provence and Languedoc. Take a wine tour to visit vineyards, taste local wines, and learn about the winemaking process. Many wineries offer guided tours and tastings, giving you the opportunity to sample a variety of wines and discover new favorites.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: The South of France offers a vibrant nightlife scene, with options ranging from chic bars to lively nightclubs: Bars and Lounges - Monaco: Enjoy classic cocktails and live jazz at Le Bar Americain, located in the Hôtel de Paris; Nice: Try creative cocktails at Le Comptoir du Marché, a trendy bar in the old town; Cannes: Experience dining and entertainment at La Folie Douce, with live music, DJs, and performances; Marseille: Visit Le Trolleybus, a popular bar with multiple rooms and music styles; Saint-Tropez: Relax at Bar du Port, known for its chic atmosphere and waterfront views. Nightclubs - Saint-Tropez: Dance at the famous Les Caves du Roy, known for its glamorous atmosphere and celebrity clientele; Nice: Party at High Club on the Promenade des Anglais, featuring multiple dance floors and top DJs; Cannes: Enjoy the stylish setting and rooftop terrace at La Suite, offering stunning views of Cannes.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Water Sports: Cannes, Nice, and Saint-Tropez - Try jet skiing or parasailing for a thrill; Toulon - Dive into the underwater world with scuba diving excursions to explore wrecks; Cerbère-Banyuls - Visit the marine reserve for an unforgettable diving experience; Mediterranean Coast - Charter a yacht or join a sailing tour to explore the coastline and nearby islands; Marseille - Go windsurfing or kitesurfing in the windy bays; Port Grimaud - Rent a paddleboard and explore the canals of this picturesque village; La Ciotat - Try snorkeling in the clear waters around the Île Verte.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: General Packing Tips and Tricks: Layering - The weather can vary, so pack layers to stay comfortable in different temperatures; Versatile Clothing - Choose items that can be mixed and matched to create multiple outfits, helping you pack lighter; Packing Cubes - Use packing cubes to organize your clothes and maximize suitcase space; Roll Your Clothes - Rolling clothes saves space and reduces wrinkles; Travel-Sized Toiletries - Bring travel-sized toiletries to save space and comply with airline regulations; Reusable Bags - Pack a few reusable bags for laundry, shoes, or shopping; First Aid Kit - Include a small first aid kit with band-aids, antiseptic wipes, and any necessary medications; Copies of Important Documents - Make copies of your passport, travel insurance, and other important documents. Keep them separate from the originals.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: To create an interactive form, use the Prepare Forms tool. See Create a form from an existing document.

To enable the Fill & Sign tools, from the hamburger menu (File menu in macOS) choose Save As Other > Acrobat Reader Extended PDF > Enable More Tools (includes Form Fill-in & Save). The tools are enabled for the current form only. When you create a different form, redo this task to enable Acrobat Reader users to use the tools.

Interactive forms contain fields that you can select and fill in. Flat forms do not have interactive fields. The Fill & Sign tool automatically detects the form fields like text fields, comb fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons. You can manually add text and other symbols anywhere on the form using the Fill & Sign tool if required.

To fill text fields: From the left panel, select Fill in form fields, and then select the field where you want to add text. It displays a text field along with a toolbar. Select the text field again and enter your text. To reposition the text box to align it with the text field, select the textbox and hover over it. Once you see a plus icon with arrows, move the textbox to the desired position. To edit the text, select the text box. Once you see the cursor and keypad, edit the text and then click elsewhere to enter. To change the text size, select A or A as required.

Open the PDF form in Acrobat or Acrobat Reader, and then choose All tools > Request E-signatures. Alternatively, you can select Sign from the top toolbar. The Request Signatures window is displayed. In the recipients field, add recipient email addresses in the order you want the document to be signed. The Mail and Message fields are just like the ones you use for sending an email and appear to your recipients in the same way. Change the default text in the Subject & Message area as appropriate.

section.text: Set the default font for adding and editing text
section.content: Set the default font for adding and editing text When you add text in a PDF, by default Acrobat chooses nearby font attributes for the new text. When you edit text, any font that isn't available on the system is substituted by a default fall-back font for the particular script. For example, Minion Pro is the default fall-back font for Roman script fonts. The substitution of unavailable fonts by default fonts can introduce inconsistency in the look and feel of text in a PDF document. To avoid inconsistency, choose a specific font for any text that is added or modified in the PDF document from Font

metadata.job_to_be_done: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Escalivada Ingredients: 2 eggplants, 2 bell peppers, 2 tomatoes, 1 small onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt. Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Roast eggplants, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onion until tender. Peel and slice vegetables. Arrange on a plate and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and serve warm or at room temperature.

Falafel Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, 1 small onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1/4 cup parsley, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon coriander, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup flour, oil for frying. Instructions: Drain and rinse chickpeas. Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt in a food processor. Add flour and mix until combined. Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden.

Baba Ganoush Ingredients: 2 eggplants, 1/4 cup tahini, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 2 cloves garlic, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt. Instructions: Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash. Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil.

Veggie Sushi Rolls Ingredients: 1 cup cooked sushi rice, 1/2 cucumber (julienned), 1/2 avocado (sliced), 1/4 cup carrot (julienned), 2 sheets nori (seaweed), soy sauce for dipping. Instructions: Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat. Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. Arrange the cucumber, avocado, and carrot in a line along the bottom edge of the rice. Roll the nori tightly using the bamboo mat. Slice into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce.

Macaroni and Cheese Ingredients: 2 cups elbow macaroni, 2 cups milk, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 tablespoons flour, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Instructions: Cook macaroni according to package instructions, then drain. Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. Add cheese, salt, and pepper, stir until melted. Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. Serve warm.

section.text: Hummus
section.content: Hummus o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Japchae o Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté sliced beef, diced onion, julienned carrot, and bell pepper in sesame oil o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. section.text: Kachumbari
section.content: Hummus Kachumbari o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. o Serve warm. Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad) o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Mix vinegar, chicken broth, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Combine potatoes, bacon, and onion with the dressing. o Serve warm or chilled. Keftedes o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Kibbeh

ranked_sections.document_title: Churros

section.text: Egg Rolls
section.content: Cornbread Egg Rolls o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Elote o Grill the corn until charred. o Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl. o Brush the mixture onto the corn. o Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder. o Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve. Empanadas o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup butter o 1/4 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup raisins o 1 teaspoon cumin o Mix flour, butter, water, and beaten egg to form a dough, then let rest. o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped olives, and raisins with cumin, paprika, and salt until cooked. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Escalivada o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander, o Drain on paper towels and serve. Farofa o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic in butter until crispy. o Add cassava flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Fattoush o 1 cup yellow split peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt o Rinse split peas and cook in water until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Blend cooked peas with onion, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. o Serve warm or chilled. Feijão Tropeiro o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic until crispy. o Add cooked beans and cassava flour, stir to combine. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Festival o Mix flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into strips. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Focaccia o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 2 1/2 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Press dough into a baking pan, dimple with fingers, and sprinkle with rosemary and sea salt. o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden. Freekeh Salad o Rinse freekeh and cook in water until tender, then drain. o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until softened. o Mix freekeh with sautéed onion, chopped parsley, and mint. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Fried Plantains o Peel and slice plantains. o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until golden. o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. o Serve warm. Fried Rice o 2 cups cooked rice o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup peas o Bring water to a boil. o Gradually add cassava flour, stirring constantly until thickened. o Continue to cook, stirring, until smooth and elastic. o Serve warm. Gamja Jorim o Peel and dice potatoes. o Sauté potatoes in sesame oil until lightly browned. o Add soy sauce, sugar, and water, simmer until potatoes are tender. o Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm. Garlic Bread o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Slice baguette in half lengthwise. o Mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt. o Spread mixture on bread. o Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Gazpacho smooth. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Gigantes Plaki o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper, simmer for 10 minutes. o Mix beans with tomato sauce and transfer to a baking dish. o Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes. o Serve warm. Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls) o Cook shrimp and slice in half. o Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain. o Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable. o Place a small amount of shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, basil, julienned carrots, and cucumber on each wrapper. o Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce. Gomae (Spinach with Sesame Dressing) o Blanch spinach in boiling water, then rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess moisture. o Toast sesame seeds and grind them. o Mix sesame seeds with soy sauce, sugar, and mirin. o Toss spinach with dressing and serve. Gratin Dauphinois o Layer potatoes in the dish, seasoning with salt and pepper. o Mix cream, milk, and minced garlic, pour over potatoes. o Sprinkle with grated Gruyère cheese. o Bake for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly. o Serve warm. Greek Salad o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Cook green beans until tender. o Mix soup, milk, salt, and pepper in a baking dish. o Add green beans and half of the fried onions, stir to combine. o Bake for 25 minutes. o Top with remaining fried onions and bake for an additional 5 minutes. o Serve warm. Guacamole o 3 avocados o 1 lime o Cut avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. o Mash the avocados with a fork. o Add lime juice, diced onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, cilantro, and garlic. o Mix well and serve immediately. Gurkensalat (Cucumber Salad) o Slice cucumbers thinly. o Mix sour cream, vinegar, sugar, dill, and salt in a bowl. o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Gyeran Jjim o Beat eggs with water, salt, and chopped green onions. o Pour mixture into a heatproof bowl. o Steam for 10-15 minutes until set. o Drizzle with sesame oil and serve warm. Harira o 1 cup lentils o 1/2 cup chickpeas o 1 small onion

section.text: Salpicão
section.content: Salpicão o Dice onion, grate carrot, and chop apple. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, carrot, apple, raisins, mayonnaise, chopped parsley, and salt. o Serve chilled. Saltfish Fritters o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Mix cod with diced onion, minced garlic, flour, water, thyme, and salt. o Form mixture into fritters. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Samosa o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup oil o 1/2 cup water o 2 potatoes o 1/2 cup peas o 1 small onion o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o Mix flour, oil, and water to form a dough, then let rest. o Boil and mash potatoes, then mix with peas, diced onion, and spices. o Roll dough into circles, cut in half, and form cones. o Fill cones with potato mixture and seal edges. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Serve warm. Satay o Cut chicken into strips and thread onto skewers. o Mix coconut milk, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, and brown sugar in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 1 hour. o Grill or broil until cooked through. o Serve with peanut sauce. Sauerkraut o Shred cabbage and mix with sea salt and caraway seeds. o Pack cabbage into a jar and press down to release juices. o Cover and let ferment at room temperature for 1-2 weeks. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Shakshuka o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Shawarma o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked through. o Slice and serve with pita bread and toppings. Skordalia o Boil potatoes until tender, then mash. o Blend mashed potatoes with minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt until o Serve as a dip or side dish. Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad) o Peel and shred green papaya and carrot. o Crush garlic and chilies in a mortar and pestle. o Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar, mix well. o Toss shredded papaya, carrot, and sliced tomatoes with the dressing. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve. Sopa de Tortilla

section.text: Mandazi
section.content: Larb Mandazi o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Mandu o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Mango Sticky Rice o Mix coconut milk with cooked rice and let sit for 10 minutes. o Serve rice with sliced mangoes. Mapo Tofu o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Mashed Potatoes o Peel and dice potatoes. o Boil potatoes until tender, then drain. o Mash potatoes with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Minestrone o 1 onion o 2 carrots o 2 celery stalks o 2 cloves garlic o 1 zucchini o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese. Miso Soup o Heat dashi broth until warm. o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. o Add diced tofu and seaweed. o Simmer for 5 minutes. o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. Moqueca de Banana

ranked_sections.document_title: Acarajé

section.text: Acarajé
section.content: Acarajé Agedashi Tofu o Cut tofu into cubes and coat with cornstarch. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Heat dashi broth with soy sauce and mirin. o Serve tofu in broth, topped with green onions and grated daikon. Aloo Gobi o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat olive oil in a pan and brown meatballs on all sides. o Add tomato sauce and simmer for 20 minutes. o Serve warm. Antipasto o Form risotto into balls and stuff with a cube of mozzarella. o Dredge balls in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Baba Ganoush o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash. o Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Baked Beans o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Sauté diced onion until translucent. o Mix beans, onion, molasses, brown sugar, ketchup, mustard, salt, and pepper in a baking dish. o Bake for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. o Serve warm. Bammy o 2 cups grated cassava o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1 teaspoon salt o Mix grated cassava with coconut milk and salt. o Form mixture into flat cakes. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Banchan o Prepare each side dish separately. o Arrange on small plates. o Serve as accompaniments to the main meal. Banh Beo o Mix rice flour, water, coconut milk, salt, and sugar to form a batter. o Pour batter into small dishes and steam until set. o Sauté chopped shrimp and green onions until cooked. o Top steamed cakes with shrimp, green onions, and fried shallots. o Serve with dipping sauce. Banh Xeo o 1 cup rice flour o 1/2 cup coconut milk o 1/2 cup water o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 pound pork o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon turmeric o Mix rice flour, coconut milk, water, turmeric, and salt to form a batter. o Sauté sliced pork, shrimp, and diced onion until cooked. o Heat oil in a pan and pour in a ladle of batter, swirling to coat the pan. o Add cooked pork, shrimp, bean sprouts, green onions, and cilantro. o Fold pancake in half and cook until crispy. o Serve with lettuce and dipping sauce. Basturma o Rub beef with salt and let cure in the refrigerator for 24 hours. o Rinse and pat dry. o Mix paprika, cumin, fenugreek, and garlic powder, then coat beef with the mixture. o Wrap in cheesecloth and hang in a cool, dry place for 1-2 weeks. o Slice thinly and serve. Batbout o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until puffed and golden. o Serve warm. Bhindi Masala o Wash and dry okra, then cut into pieces. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute. o Add okra and stir to coat with spices. o Cook until okra is tender, stirring occasionally. o Add salt to taste and serve. Bobotie o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add ground beef, raisins, almonds, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook until beef is browned. o Transfer mixture to a baking dish. o Beat eggs with milk and pour over the beef mixture. o Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. o Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden. o Serve warm. Bok Choy with Garlic o 1 pound bok choy o Sauté minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bok choy and stir-fry until tender. o Add soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes. o Serve warm. Bolinho de Bacalhau o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Boil potatoes until tender, then mash. o Mix cod with mashed potatoes, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and beaten eggs. o Form mixture into balls and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Bouillabaisse o Add diced tomatoes, fish stock, wine, saffron, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer for 20 minutes. o Add fish fillets, shrimp, and mussels, cook until seafood is done. o Serve hot with crusty bread. Bratkartoffeln (Fried Potatoes) o Boil potatoes until tender, then slice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté sliced potatoes and diced onion in butter until golden. o Stir in bacon, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Briam o 1/2 pound ground beef o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Stir in chopped parsley, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. o Cut phyllo dough into strips and brush with melted butter. o Place a spoonful of filling on each strip and fold into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Bruschetta o Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Dice tomatoes and chop basil. o Mix tomatoes, basil, minced garlic, olive oil, and salt. o Spoon mixture onto toasted bread and serve. Bulgur Pilaf o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until bulgur is tender. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Ca Tim Nuong (Grilled Eggplant) o Grill eggplants until charred and tender. o Peel and slice eggplants. o Mix minced garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar in a bowl. o Toss eggplants with the dressing. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve. Callaloo o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add callaloo leaves and cook until wilted. o Stir in coconut milk, thyme, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Serve warm. Canh Chua o 4 cups fish stock o 1/2 pound fish fillets o 1 cup pineapple o 1 cup tomatoes o 1 cup bean sprouts o 2 stalks lemongrass o Bring fish stock to a boil. o Add lemongrass, chilies, and tamarind paste, simmer for 10 minutes. o Add pineapple, tomatoes, and fish fillets, cook until fish is done. o Stir in fish sauce, sugar, and bean sprouts. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve. Caprese Salad o Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. o Arrange on a plate, alternating slices. o Sprinkle with chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic glaze, and salt. o Serve immediately. Carrot Salad o Grate carrots and mix with raisins and chopped parsley. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve chilled. Ceviche o 1 pound fresh fish or shrimp o 1 cup lime juice o Dice fish or shrimp and place in a bowl. o Pour lime juice over the seafood and let marinate for 30 minutes. o Dice onion, tomatoes, and jalapeño. o Chop cilantro. o Mix all ingredients together and add salt. o Serve chilled. Cha Gio o Mix ground pork, chopped shrimp, diced mushrooms, julienned carrots, chopped green onions, minced garlic, fish sauce, and sugar in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Chakchouka o 4 tomatoes o 2 bell peppers o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 4 eggs o 1/4 cup cilantro o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell peppers in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm. Chana Masala o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, coriander, garam masala, and turmeric, cook for 1 minute. o Add chickpeas and diced tomatoes, stir to combine. o Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. o Add salt to taste and serve. Chapati o Mix flour, oil, water, and salt to form a dough, then let rest. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Char Siu o Mix hoisin sauce, soy sauce, honey, rice wine, five-spice powder, and garlic powder in a bowl. o Marinate pork in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Place pork on a baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally. o Let rest before slicing and serving. Chawanmushi o Beat eggs with dashi broth, soy sauce, and mirin. o Place chicken, shrimp, and mushrooms in small bowls. o Pour egg mixture over the top. o Steam for 15 minutes until set. o Serve warm. Chiles Rellenos

Nom Du Du (Green Papaya Salad) o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Nuoc Cham o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, minced garlic, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. o Serve as a dipping sauce. Oi Muchim o Slice cucumbers thinly. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, gochugaru, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Onigiri (Rice Balls) o Wet hands and shape rice into balls or triangles. o Make a small indentation and add filling. o Wrap with a strip of nori. o Serve immediately. Pão de Queijo o Remove from heat and stir in tapioca flour until smooth. o Let cool slightly, then mix in grated cheese and beaten eggs. o Form dough into balls and place on a baking sheet. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm.
